org.safs.model.tools

Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.safs.model.tools.AbstractDriver
      • org.safs.model.tools.Driver

  • public class Driver
extends AbstractDriver
    A JSAFSDriver wrapper attempting to provide a minimalist (simple) interface--hiding a good bit of JSAFS complexity.

    Since:
    OCT 15, 2013
    Author:
    Carl Nagle
    See Also:
    JSAFSDriver

      java.lang.Thread SHUTDOWN_HOOK
      This is an 'AfterAll' JVM ShutdownHook--if it is needed.

    • Field Detail

      • running

        public static boolean running

      • allow_shutdown

        public static boolean allow_shutdown
        Set to false to prevent JSAFS from shutting down on a call to shutdownJSAFS(). Default is true. JSAFS shutting down will NOT force a System exit on shutdown.
        See Also:
        shutdownJSAFS()

      • SHUTDOWN_HOOK

        public final java.lang.Thread SHUTDOWN_HOOK
        This is an 'AfterAll' JVM ShutdownHook--if it is needed.

      • setIDriver

        public static void setIDriver(DriverInterface iDriver)

      • getIDriver

        public static DriverInterface getIDriver()

      • iDriver

        public DriverInterface iDriver()
        Overrides:
        iDriver in class AbstractDriver
        Returns:
        DriverInterface currently being used.
        Could be a JSAFSDriver. Could be an InputProcessor.
        Subclasses should override to support other DriverInterface instances not tracked in this superclass. Can be null if none are set.
        See Also:
        #setIDriver(DriverInterface), JSAFSDriver, InputProcessor

      • initializeJSAFS

        protected void initializeJSAFS()
        Try to initialize the internal JSAFSDriver if both jsafs and processor are null.

      • beforeAll

        public void beforeAll()
        Must be called at least once to initialize the internal JSAFSDriver. This will be called automatically when using AutoConfigureJSAFS and Runner.autorun appropriately.

        It can be called automatically by annotations (dependency injection), or be called from an overriding test controller like a JUnit runner, if appropriate.

        See Also:
        AutoConfigureJSAFS, Runner.autorun(String[])

      • shutdownJSAFS

        public static void shutdownJSAFS()
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Used to invoke the JSAFSDriver shutdown function. The routine will only invoke the function if allow_shutdown = true.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        allow_shutdown, JSAFSDriver.shutdown()

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: AbstractDriver
        Shutdown the driver and all related resources such as hooks, engines, services and logs etc.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in class AbstractDriver
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • run

        public void run()
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: AbstractDriver
        Initiates the embedded drivers and engines to start running if it is not already running. The user should call this method to ensure the drivers/engines are initialized before using them.
        Specified by:
        run in class AbstractDriver
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
